thread.title: Gestamp Completes 31MW Solar Plant in Ibaraki
thread.title_full: Gestamp Completes 31MW Solar Plant in Ibaraki

title: Gestamp Completes 31MW Solar Plant in Ibaraki
text:
Gestamp Completes 31MW Solar Plant in Ibaraki Gestamp Completes 31MW Solar Plant in Ibaraki 2015/09/26 17:41 Kenji Kaneko, Nikkei BP CleanTech Institute The ceremony to celebrate the completion of the plant (source: Nikkei BP) An aerial view of the plant (source: Gestamp Asetym Solar Japan) 
Gestamp Asetym Solar Japan had a ceremony to celebrate the completion of a solar power plant with an output of about 31MW Sept 18, 2015. 
The plant was built on the site of a former golf course in Daigo-machi, Ibaraki Prefecture, Japan. This will be the Gestamp group's first renewable energy-based power plant that has started operations in Japan. 
For the plant, 126,408 units of Yingli Solar's polycrystalline silicon solar panel and 26 units of Switzerland-based ABB's PV inverter (rated output: 1MW) were set up. The mounting system employed for the plant is a screw pile type manufactured by Gestamp Steel Industries.
